title: Psychological Association Accused Of 'Complicity' In Bush-Era Torture
teaser: NPR's Arun Rath speaks with James Risen of the New York Times about a new report alleging that the American Psychological Association helped justify prisoner torture.
contentencoded:
NPR's Arun Rath speaks with James Risen of the New York Times about a new report alleging that the American Psychological Association worked closely with the George W. Bush administration to help justify prisoner torture.

Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
